00030 /// \brief
00031 /// The FdoINetworkCommand is the base of all the FDO network analysis comands.
00032 /// \note
00033 /// This Help topic is provided for informational use only. There is
00034 /// no interface or support provided. Autodesk reserves the right to change
00035 /// the software related to the content herein.
00036 class FdoINetworkCommand : public FdoICommand
00037 {
00038     friend class FdoIConnection;
00039 
00040 public:
00041     /// \brief
00042     /// Gets the name of the network.
00043     /// 
00044     /// \return
00045     /// Returns the network class name.
00046     /// 
00047     FDO_API virtual GisString* GetNetworkName() = 0;
00048 
00049     /// \brief
00050     /// This method is used to set the name of the network that will be used for the network analysis.
00051     /// 
00052     /// \param value 
00053     /// Input the name of the network.
00054     /// 
00055     /// \return
00056     /// Returns nothing
00057     /// 
00058     FDO_API virtual void SetNetworkName(GisString* value) = 0;
00059 
00060     /// \brief
00061     /// Gets the name of the class to be operated upon as an FdoIdentifier.
00062     /// 
00063     /// \return
00064     /// Returns the layer name.
00065     /// 
00066     FDO_API virtual GisString* GetNetworkLayerName() = 0;
00067 
00068     /// \brief
00069     /// This method is used to set the name of the layer that will be used for the network analysis. 
00070     /// If the layer is not set, the analysis will be performed across all layers.
00071     /// 
00072     /// \param value 
00073     /// Input the layer name.
00074     /// 
00075     /// \return
00076     /// Returns nothing
00077     /// 
00078     FDO_API virtual void SetNetworkLayerName(GisString* value) = 0;
00079 
00080     /// \brief
00081     /// This method is used to get the maximum cost value.
00082     /// 
00083     /// \return
00084     /// Returns the cost value.
00085     /// 
00086     FDO_API virtual double GetMaximumCost() = 0;
00087 
00088     /// \brief
00089     /// This method is used to set an optional maximum cost value. 
00090     /// This value will be used to limit the network analysis to a given cost.
00091     /// 
00092     /// \param value 
00093     /// Input the cost value.
00094     /// 
00095     /// \return
00096     /// Returns nothing
00097     /// 
00098     FDO_API virtual void SetMaximumCost(double value) = 0;
00099 
00100     /// \brief
00101     /// Gets the maximum depth value.
00102     /// 
00103     /// \return
00104     /// Returns the class name.
00105     /// 
00106     FDO_API virtual int GetMaximumDepth() = 0;
00107 
00108     /// \brief
00109     /// This method is used to set an optional maximum depth value. This value will 
00110     /// be used to limit the network analysis to a given depth. A depth of 1 limits the analysis 
00111     /// to the adjacent nodes.
00112     /// 
00113     /// \param value 
00114     /// Input the depth value.
00115     /// 
00116     /// \return
00117     /// Returns nothing
00118     /// 
00119     FDO_API virtual void SetMaximumDepth(int value) = 0;
00120 
00121     /// \brief
00122     /// This method is used to set an optional filter that resolve to a 
00123     /// set of nodes that need to be excluded.
00124     /// 
00125     /// \param className 
00126     /// is the class name used to set the context of the filter.
00127     /// \param filter 
00128     /// a filter that defines a group of nodes.
00129     /// 
00130     /// \return
00131     /// Returns nothing
00132     /// 
00133     FDO_API virtual void SetExcludeNodes(GisString* className, FdoFilter *filter) = 0;
00134 
00135     /// \brief
00136     /// This method is used to set an optional filter that resolve to a set of nodes that need to be included.
00137     /// 
00138     /// \param className 
00139     /// is the class name used to set the context of the filter.
00140     /// \param filter 
00141     /// a filter that defines a group of nodes.
00142     /// 
00143     /// \return
00144     /// Returns nothing
00145     /// 
00146     FDO_API virtual void SetIncludeNodes(GisString* className, FdoFilter *filter) = 0;
00147 
00148     /// \brief
00149     /// This method performs the network analysis and returns a network path reader.
00150     /// 
00151     /// \return
00152     /// Returns a network reader.
00153     /// 
00154     FDO_API virtual FdoINetworkReader* Execute() = 0;
00155 };
00156 #endif
